summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 12, 2019, regarding the incarceration and death of Jeffrey Epstein. The interview covers Epstein's arrival, housing in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), a prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, policies on suicide watch and cellmate assignments, staffing issues, and the circumstances leading up to his death on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt/Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell with his cellmate in an incident initially thought to be a suicide attempt. Epstein denied it, saying he thought he was having a heart attack. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cellmate Released
events.description: Inmate , Epstein's assigned cellmate, was released from MCC "with all belongings," leaving Epstein without a cellmate in his SHU cell.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: Correctional Officers discovered Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his SHU cell during evening rounds. Officer Michael Thomas initiated life-saving measures. Epstein was pronounced dead at an outside hospital.

events.title: OIG Interview of Warden
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, sworn interview with the MCC Warden regarding the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

events.title: Epstein's Arrival at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, on a weekend without prior notification to the Warden. He was initially processed and later placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

locations: Suicide watch area (second floor, hospital area) at MCC
keyFacts: The Warden stated he was not formally notified in advance of Jeffrey Epstein's arrival at the MCC; he learned about it on Monday after Epstein was dropped off over a weekend.
The Warden received a direct order from his Regional Director to keep Epstein in the Special Housing Unit and not place him in general population.
After a July 23 incident, psychology staff directed that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times. The Warden personally selected inmate as that cellmate.
Inmate was released from MCC on August 9, 2019. The Warden stated staff failed to follow his standing order to notify the chain of command that Epstein was then without a cellmate.

The Warden described the MCC as understaffed (around 80%) and reliant on overtime, and that the institution's camera system was outdated and unreliable, with recording issues known prior to Epstein's death.
